Evening Galas Mark Youth Day in DPRK
Youth Day Celebrated in DPRK
articles.content:
Evening Galas Mark Youth Day in DPRK 
    Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Evening galas of youth and students were held in different parts of the country on Aug. 28 in celebration of the Youth Day.
 The evening galas began as the song "Waltz of Youth Day" resounded forth.
 Youth and students in Pyongyang danced to the tune of "Dear Name," "Pride of Youth," "Girl on a Galloping Steed," "Let's Meet on the Front" and other songs at the plazas in front of the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Monument to Party Founding, the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium and other places.    
 Similar events also took place in Sinuiju, Hamhung, Sariwon and other provincial capitals, cities and county seats. 
 The participants in the evening galas fully demonstrated their firm determination to perform feats and emerge young heroes by making a breakthrough in the on-going general march for Songun revolution.

articles.content:
Youth Day Celebrated in DPRK 
    Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Youth Day was significantly celebrated in various parts of the country Sunday.
 Senior party and state officials including Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Thae Bok and leading officials of the Party and power bodies and working people's organizations in the capital and local areas visited Kim Il Sung University, the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex, the youth work team of the Kubin Stock-Farm in Kangdong County, the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex and other industrial establishments, farms and universities and colleges to congratulate the young people there on the day. 
 They, together with senior party and state officials, laid floral baskets and bouquets before President Kim Il Sung's statues, portraits of the smiling President and monuments to his revolutionary activities.    
 The senior officials looked round the revolutionary museums and rooms dedicated to the history of the units they visited.    
 After going round production sites and universities and other places, they met exemplary cadres and members of primary organizations of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League and labour innovators and told them about the noble intention of the Workers' Party of Korea associated with the slogan "Love the Youth!" They expressed firm expectation that all the young people would glorify the ideas of Kim Il Sung and leader     Kim Jong Il on the youth movement and their exploits performed in leading it and work heroic feats in the general march for Songun revolution. 
 The young people in different parts of the country spent the significant holiday with art performances, sports and amusement games, dancing parties and other colorful events.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Receives Thai FM
Kim Yong Nam Meets Thai FM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Receives Thai FM 
    Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, met and had a friendly conversation with Thai Foreign Minister Kantathi Suphamongkhon and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
 Present there were Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned and Jullapong Nonsrichai, Thai ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Il Sung from Thai PM and FM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Thai FM
    Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met Thai Foreign Minister Kantathi Suphamongkhon and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
 Present there were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Yong Il, officials concerned and Thai Ambassador to the DPRK Jullapong Nonsrichai.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Thai PM, FM
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Il Sung from Thai PM and FM
    Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was presented with gifts by Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra and Foreign Minister Kantathi Suphamongkhon of Thailand.
 The gifts were conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by the visiting Thai foreign minister on Monday.

articles.title: "Arirang" Performers Admired for Gymnastic Skill
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Thai PM, FM
    Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with gifts by Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra and Foreign Minister Kantathi Suphamongkhon.
 The gifts were handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday by the foreign minister of Thailand who is visiting the DPRK.

articles.content:
Chinese Foreign Ministry Delegation Leaves
    Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Chinese Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Wu Dawei left here today.
 It was seen off by officials concerned and the Chinese ambassador to the DPRK and staff members of the embassy here.
